(Simplified: 鹕)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 胡 indicates the sound; 鳥 (bird) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 胡 [ hú ] recklessly, foolishly; wildly
    • 鳥 [ niǎo ] bird
①(鵜鶘)見“(鶘)鵜”。

鶘字的康熙字典解释

【亥集中】【鳥字部】　鶘； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页1494第30
【玉篇】戸徒切【集韻】【韻會】洪孤切，?音胡。鵜鶘也。【莊子·外物篇】魚不畏網，而畏鵜鶘。【山海經】廬其之山，無草木，多沙石，沙水出焉，南流注于涔水中，多?鶘，狀如鴛鴦，人足，其鳴自詨。【註】今鵜鶘，足頗似人脚。

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Hai Collection] [Birds Department] 　lican; Kangxi strokes: 20; page number: page 1494 30
[Jade articles] Jiantuqie [Jiyun] [Yunhui] Hong Guqie,? Yinhu. Pelicans too. [Zhuangzi·Foreign Objects] Fish are not afraid of nets, but pelicans. [Shanhaijing] The mountain of Luqi is without vegetation, sand and rocks, sand and water flow out, and the south flows into the water, and there are many licans, which are like mandarin ducks, human feet, and their voices are self-sufficient. [Note] Today's pelican is quite like human feet.
